column1: This #Thanksgiving may look different because of #COVID19 and my thoughts are with everyone who has experienced loss this year. In these hard times I am grateful for the opportunity to serve and work alongside the Hampton Roads community. https://t.co/x217vj1V93
My virtual town hall on health care and COVID-19 just started! Join us live on Facebook at https://t.co/eENuL64pvO.

On Tuesday November 24th I will be hosting a virtual Facebook town hall on the ACA open enrollment and new guidelines to control the COVID-19 pandemic. I hope you will join us or submit a question here: https://t.co/N0mensyGFq
Virginia was one of the first states to launch a COVID-19 tracking app. Please download it and turn on notifications.  https://t.co/u5e1cyO6UA
New measures are now in place to stop the spread of COVID-19 in Virginia. Make sure you familiarize yourself with the new updates. https://t.co/6hpIXerQyG
The country is in the middle of a spike in COVID-19 infections. Wear a mask. Observe social distancing. Wash your hands.

During this COVID-19 pandemic access to affordable quality health coverage is more important than ever. Enrollment in https://t.co/aUuUw8G2OG is open from November 1 to December 15.  Coverage may be more affordable than you think. #GetCovered https://t.co/ObzHB1F51I

Not testing for COVID-19 doesn't make it go away. And not studying climate change will not stop the climate crisis but it will limit our ability to respond and help communities adapt. We must defend @NOAA's scientific integrity. https://t.co/FtpuHXduKQ

#COVID19 has impacted communities of color at an alarming rate and shown the clear inequities of our public health system and now @EPA is gutting regulations that are meant to #ProtectCleanWater and keep families healthy. #CWA48
The #COVID19 pandemic is fueling a housing crisis.    #KnowYour Rights. Find out if you qualify for protection from eviction.   Visit https://t.co/aFJEvcsovI for more information.
Seems like a good time to remind people that COVID-19 is dangerous and has cost over 200000 Americans their lives. Wear a mask. Observe social distancing. Do your part.

While Senate Republicans have been cutting taxes for the wealthy & harming the economy by not taking further action to address the COVID-19 pandemic the House has passed bills to rebuild our economy & raise wages #ForThePeople. https://t.co/78Z8QVFmt6

Met with officials from @HamptonCSchools at Phenix School to see how school meals are distributed during the COVID-19 pandemic. We must ensure children are not going hungry when schools are closed. https://t.co/18lBRsp4FE

It is telling that Senate Republicans feel the urgency to confirm a Supreme Court justice but are content to sit back while millions of children do not have enough to eat. We must pass a comprehensive COVID-19 package that provides immediate relief to struggling families.

Since the COVID-19 pandemic began there has been a rise in reports of hate crimes and racist incidents against those of Asian descent. We must call out and condemn the anti-Asian sentiment that has occurred. https://t.co/Z65JJxzjhK

March 19: 12600+ confirmed COVID cases in U.S. 265 confirmed COVID deaths in U.S. Today: 6334150+ confirmed COVID cases in U.S. 189970+ confirmed COVID deaths in U.S. #TrumpKnew and downplayed the crisis. https://t.co/NkAKm2q6vy
It is a holiday weekend but remember that COVID-19 does not go on vacation.   Be safe. Wear a mask. Observe social distancing.

Today is #NationalPollWorkerRecruitmentDay! We are experiencing a significant shortage of poll workers due to the COVID-19 pandemic. Sign up to be a poll worker on November 3 here: https://t.co/pNKhozft5d

Here is where we are at in the fight against COVID-19.  ➡️5 million cases ➡️160000 deaths ➡️55 million first-time unemployment claims  The House passed the #HeroesAct three months ago and the White House & Senate Republicans still can’t agree among themselves on a path forward.

Be sure to check out @VDHgov’s new app to help stop #COVID19 in Virginia. This tool can make a real difference—and the more Virginians who use it the better it works.  Join the movement and download #COVIDWISE for free in the App Store and on Google Play. https://t.co/VFWtTt7kBD https://t.co/hCwV5KQwuH

American communities are still struggling to get the protective equipment needed to weather the COVID-19 pandemic. Enough waiting. The Defense Production Act is for moments like this and President Trump needs to take action. #FamiliesFirst https://t.co/X7UFK1pu6i
May 15: 1449026 COVID-19 cases in the US  Today: Roughly 3800000 cases in the US  It’s been two months since the House passed the #HeroesAct – the Republican Senate needs to act.

I will be hosting a virtual discussion w/ educators from VA's 3rd Congressional District tomorrow at 10am. We will discuss plans to safely re-open schools & how to keep everyone safe from #COVID19. Live stream will be on my facebook page. Tune in! #VA03  https://t.co/Ta3c5ReuSD

Virginia has approved an Emergency standard to protect workers from #COVID19 and I applaud @GovernorVA for his leadership on this issue. Without any real action from the federal @OSHA_DOL Virginia’s actions are critical to preventing more infections. https://t.co/vZKof7DuWP

Joining @SpeakerPelosi and other @HouseDemocrats to call on the Senate to pass the #HeroesAct. This bill would provide critical funding for schools and families as communities hurdle toward an economic cliff and coronavirus cases surge across America. https://t.co/yDmGDppT0B
Wear a mask. Maintain social distance. Avoid large crowds. https://t.co/Ecw4zlTTQP
I am currently hosting a telephone town hall on #COVID19 and efforts to reform policing in America. Live stream can be found at the links below.  https://t.co/Ta3c5ReuSD https://t.co/objry2DtgP
The last thing we need right now is a testing slowdown. The Senate must pass the #HeroesAct to ensure coronavirus testing is available nationwide https://t.co/NzoluNvJg2
Join me at 7pm tonight for my telephone town hall where we will discuss #COVID19 as well as police reform.   https://t.co/zfG9WOSmC6

I am going to be holding a Telephone Town Hall on Monday July 13th at 7:00pm. This will be a chance to discuss the COVID-19 pandemic as well as the George Floyd #JusticeInPolicing Act. You can register and stream the town hall at the link below.  https://t.co/objry2DtgP
If we’re going to beat #COVID19 we need to know more about it. That’s why federal investments in research & development are more important than ever. https://t.co/BWJA6obD9n

Got tested for #COVID19 at Ivy Baptist Church’s community testing event. Aggressive testing and contact tracing will limit the spread of COVID-19 and help us reopen our economy. https://t.co/tYvUZ4YwoV
At least 127000 Americans have died from COVID-19. Over 2.9 million cases have been reported in the US.  "Live with it" is not an acceptable response from the White House.  https://t.co/S1fmz7sDpn

.@OSHA_DOL under President Trump's leadership has yet to issue any enforceable standard to keep workers safe from #COVID19. I am thankful Virginia's Department of Labor & Industry has stepped up to keep Virginia's workers safe. https://t.co/JVJ4GrVSoy
The #MovingForward Act is a critical step towards helping our students and our economy recover from the #COVID19 pandemic. https://t.co/Ifz6Gc9U2j
WATCH: @EdLaborCmte's hearing on "Budget Cuts and Lost Learning: Assessing the Impact of COVID-19 on Public Education" https://t.co/fuoFNjT38L

Coronavirus cases are spiking in a number of states. Tens of millions of Americans have filed for unemployment during the #COVID19 pandemic. The House passed the urgently-needed #HeroesAct weeks ago yet Senate Republicans have no new plan to help our states cities or hospitals. https://t.co/bBKQboKs1v
Attended a great event about the importance of getting tested for #COVID19.  https://t.co/m5Ss4nzdno https://t.co/5JQijDQZpK
Today we observe June 1st as the National Day of Mourning. We honor all those who have fallen to COVID-19. #DayofMourning https://t.co/boZLOhLdVk

I would urge the Senate to pass the #HeroesAct and for President Trump to sign it to rapidly ramp up testing and contact tracing and provide relief to workers dealing with the economic crisis created by the rapid spread of #COVID19.

This is a devastating loss of life for families across the nation. As we move forward we must be sure to follow the advice of public health experts be honest with the American people and do all we can to ramp up testing and tracing to contain further spread of #COVID19. https://t.co/g052NL8BTO

Older Americans are particularly vulnerable to the physical emotional and financial consequences of #COVID19. The CARES Act provides aging adults with significant support to get through this pandemic. #OlderAmericansMonth https://t.co/ecR4NB3aEH

This #OlderAmericansMonth we celebrate the contributions seniors have made in our communities. As we confront the #COVID19 pandemic we must ensure they have the support they need. The #FamiliesFirst Coronavirus Response Act provided support for nutrition services for seniors. https://t.co/w8RIOGFOsm

This week @EPAAWheeler ignored the request I made with 75+ of my colleagues as well as those of doctors and scientists and rushed forward with his #CensoredScience rule. Limiting the EPA's use of public health studies to inform its rules is especially offensive during #COVID19. https://t.co/pxRpt1A7qo

.@usedgov needs to rescind its “equitable service” guidance which would redirect #COVID19 relief funding away from students in public schools to fund services for students in private schools regardless of their wealth or residence.  https://t.co/TmlI5kJYWb
Be sure you sign up for my e-newsletter below! You will receive updates on #COVID19 as well as other useful information from my office.  https://t.co/XjlgixRxdu
Spoke with @NPR on why @BetsyDeVosED should not be using #COVID19 relief money for private school vouchers.  https://t.co/JxRNjeLTUT

The SCOTUS decision in #BrownvBoard made a promise that we have yet to fulfill. Our response to the #COVID19 crisis must reflect Chief Justice Warren’s declaration that public education “is a right which must be made available to all on equal terms.” https://t.co/OA9Z5Bw5hL

Our students workers and families cannot wait for relief. Every day the financial and human cost of the #COVID19 pandemic rises. The #HeroesAct reflects the sense of urgency that this crisis demands. We must take the next vital step and advance this bill through the Senate. https://t.co/8o1DPysqFA
The #HeroesAct would provide resources to our local and state governments and ensure they can get through the #COVID19 pandemic. https://t.co/67ecgnZdV4
The #HeroesAct is a comprehensive federal response that matches the scale of the #COVID19 crisis. https://t.co/YtdU6ifHSo

The #HeroesAct requires the Trump Administration to finally develop a plan for robust testing and contact tracing and also ensures that everyone has access to health care coverage and can seek treatment for #COVID19 without any out-of-pocket costs. https://t.co/OdPDCntOdO

P-EBT is a necessary program that ensures school closures do not prevent students from accessing nutritious food. As the #COVID19 pandemic continues I urge @USDA to continue approving state plans to ensure families are supported in the coming months. https://t.co/08UmIrqcU5

It is alarming that instead of focusing on helping students educators and institutions cope with the COVID-19 pandemic @usedgov wasted valuable time finalizing a rule that will erode protections for students’ safety. My full statement with @RepJerryNadler below. https://t.co/bfDQGK1e9j
.@rolandsmartin and I discussed why Congress must pass the #COVID19 Every Worker Protection Act which would force @OSHA_DOL to take meaningful action to protect workers. ⤵️ https://t.co/lyOt5IQOzw

Without more emergency #COVID19 relief hundreds of thousands of teachers and school staff will be laid-off in the months ahead. We must honor #TeacherAppreciationWeek by giving schools and states the resources they need to avert devastating cuts to public education.

Providing resources to the nation’s workforce system is a critical step in relaunching America’s economy as we begin to recover from #Covid_19. The Relaunching America’s Workforce Act is a desperately needed investment in workers employers & our economy. https://t.co/2mgvagh0DB

I will be hosting a Telephone Town Hall tomorrow night at 7pm to discuss the continued spread of #COVID19 as well as supports available to individuals families students workers and small business owners. Sign up to join the call below.  https://t.co/objry2DtgP

It is profoundly disturbing that President Trump is using his authority to force workers into dangerous conditions without providing enforceable safety standards to protect them from #COVID19. https://t.co/5WtBTrLaaf

If the Trump Administration will not fulfill its responsibility to protect workers Congress must act. That is why I introduced the #COVID19 Every Worker Protection Act which requires the @USDOL to strengthen protections for all workers. https://t.co/VGyBMIpcER

Today is #WorkersMemorialDay. We are in the middle of a global pandemic. Workers are falling ill and dying from #COVID19. But President Trump's @OSHA_DOL has failed to issue an emergency standard to keep our workers safe.

My office is hosting the Annual Congressional Art Competition. Due to the spread of #COVID19 we will be conducting the contest virtually this year. More information and guidelines can be found below.  https://t.co/NzcX7xhxel

I participated in a @JointCenter briefing to discuss the disparities faced by Black communities in the #COVID19 crisis and the need for a stimulus package that advances equity for Black workers businesses and student success. https://t.co/R1cLgbiJ2V
Thank you to my niece Jocie for making me a mask to use while I am working in Washington today to help pass aid for small businesses hospitals and testing for #COVID19. https://t.co/uPBNeo3Mpd

I'll be joining @NAACP and @BET TONIGHT @ 7pm ET for an important virtual town hall on how we address the impact of the coronavirus pandemic. Register here to join the discussion: https://t.co/klXtuHoblj https://t.co/eLQXAlxteS

Pollution in black Latino and low-income communities have made COVID-19 even more deadly. @EPAAWheeler must address this grave injustice and protect the air we all depend on regardless of where we live. This #EarthDay I was pleased to join @RepBobbyRush in demanding action. https://t.co/JDyxQJUaEJ

Yesterday I introduced the COVID-19 Every Worker Protection Act that directs @OSHA_DOL to issue an emergency standard within 7 days that outlines how workplaces must protect workers – like shipyard workers.    https://t.co/pbFHnrLjeH

We are confronting the most devastating pandemic in our lifetime with #COVID19. Thousands of workers are suffering preventable illness and death. But President Trump's @OSHA_DOL is nowhere to be found.   https://t.co/4UkF2NF0yo
Be sure to sign up for my e-newsletter to receive information on #COVIDー19 and other important updates from my office. https://t.co/XjlgixRxdu

The #CARESAct provided emergency funding to help Virginia’s students families educators & schools cope with the impact of the #COVIDー19. I am pleased that we were able to secure this $67 million in financial support for education in the Commonwealth. https://t.co/C2BsbdBhiB

Virginia will receive over $70 million in emergency child care funding from the #CARESAct.  This funding will help child care providers to help pay employees maintain/resume operations & provide child care assistance for essential workers. #COVID19 https://t.co/kuf32CCcCn

Yesterday @EPAAWheeler against the @EPA's own scientists recommendations announced plans to maintain the status quo on deadly soot pollution. This disproportionately harms poor and minority communities and makes them more vulnerable to #coronavirus. https://t.co/d1IQpe4HSS

-More disaster loans -Support for rural and underserved communities -Access to @SBAgov programs for farmers Any #COVID19 relief bill must include these fixes if we want to help small businesses weather this crisis. https://t.co/txaumhB6mh

Today is #TaxDay - a reminder that due to #COVID19 you now have until July 15th to file federal taxes and Virginia state taxes are now due June 1st. If you owe state taxes interest may accrue after May 1st.

During the #COVID19 crisis it is critical that workers maintain access health care. The Worker Health Coverage Protection Act would provide relief to workers and families by making sure they do not lose their health insurance in the middle of a pandemic. https://t.co/HMWykYmedT
The @CDCgov recommends wearing a mask while in public to help stop the spread of #COVID19. @RepMarkTakano shows us how to make a mask at home. https://t.co/b0Mn0HDmsW

The #COVID19 public health emergency is putting an enormous strain on our higher education system. I am very pleased to see colleges/universities in Virginia’s Third Congressional District will receive $46 million in emergency funding from the #CARESAct.  https://t.co/RpSvWO9Z02
If you need to update your direct deposit information you may do that next week on this website. Please check back for updates. #COVID19 #CARESAct

Thank you to our nation’s health care professionals first responders grocery store workers caretakers janitorial staff postal workers truck drivers and all the brave Americans who keep working tirelessly to get us through the #COVID19 crisis. https://t.co/cs5BhMuoRd

Rushing regulations through during COVID-19 would hinder the @EPA's mission to protect human health & the environment. For that reason I led 75+ of my colleagues in sending  a letter to @EPAAWheeler urging him to extend comment periods on pending regs. https://t.co/j2CGfYSLg1

I was pleased to see community health centers in Hampton Roads receive critical funds from @HRSAgov. These two health centers will be able to use these additional funds to respond to the #COVID19 crisis. https://t.co/TCeR627ktm
The National Domestic Violence Hotline is 1-800-799-7233 and https://t.co/SoCGq8zjvx. #COVID19  https://t.co/4VzX79Dagy
I am holding a telephone town hall tonight on #COVID19. The call will focus on relief for small businesses and unemployment insurance. Sign up to join the call below.   https://t.co/objry2DtgP
Make sure you are subscribed to my e-newsletter updates. We are sending out important information on #COVID19 that you may find helpful. https://t.co/XjlgixRxdu
Food insecurity is a reality for too many people in Virginia as we fight the spread of #COVID19. Learn more about the resources available to you and your loved ones here: https://t.co/R7dg0Vzcaa
We must put #FamiliesFirst as we confront the #COVID19 pandemic. Learn more about the resources available to you and your family in this toolkit: https://t.co/uVvFvOh5kf
Today’s grim jobs report captures only a fraction of the economic hardship that workers families and businesses will face in the months ahead due to #COVID19. https://t.co/zTEtpPBY6x
Follow @GovernorVA's Twitter Q&A on #COVID19. #AskGovNortham https://t.co/jhWJuWF2if

This is another example of this administration’s failure to implement an urgent coherent & effective strategy to protect our communities from the spread of #COVIDー19.  The Affordable Care Act’s Marketplaces can serve a critical role in helping people access the care they need.

I'm also dismayed by @EPAAWheeler and @NHTSAgov's "SAFE Vehicles Rule." This rollback makes communities less safe. In addition to intensifying the climate crisis increased air pollution worsens health issues like asthma and may increase #COVID19 susceptibility. https://t.co/zvFrRbMRDb
.@GovernorVA ordered a statewide Stay At Home order for all Virginians to help stop the spread of #COVID19. Click below if you have questions about the order.  https://t.co/NFQXxXZbkk
The CARES Act will send money directly to Americans to help deal with the spread of #COVID19. Find more information about the bill here. https://t.co/LYrWwPqpUd
I am holding a Telephone Town Hall on #COVID19 at 7pm tonight. Follow along below.  https://t.co/objry2DtgP

.@GovernorVA has issued a stay at home order for all Virginians until June 10th to help slow the spread of #COVID19. Find more information below about what is allowed during this time. https://t.co/fPY52cibGB

I will be calling in to HearSay with Cathy Lewis today at 12pm to discuss how the federal government is responding to the #COVID19 pandemic and the work we have done to guarantee paid leave free testing for COVID-19 and maintain access to school meals. https://t.co/j016nwBu5Z

My home church held Sunday worship service this morning using remote conferencing apps. I encourage all other congregations to take advantage of today’s technology to abide by social distancing guidelines. #COVID19
On Friday the CARES Act was signed into law to respond to the spread of #COVID19. See some of the details of the bill below.  https://t.co/T3nEep1aI4

I just spoke on the House floor in support of the CARES Act. We must ensure that families have continued access to income education and health care during the #COVID19 pandemic. https://t.co/c5MVfTN9lO

Though their buildings are closed to prevent the spread of #COVID19 public libraries remain a refuge for students and their families. @NNLibrary has digital and audio resources for teens and online storytime and other resources for children. https://t.co/vGP3x91tfh
If you have any questions on how Congress the Administration and the Commonwealth of Virginia have responded to the COVID-19 pandemic you can click below.  https://t.co/ppbQuk45K8

Today is the 10th anniversary of the ACA. The Trump Administration must end its lawsuit which would strike down the law as well as pre-existing condition protections for 130 million Americans especially amid the #COVID19 pandemic. #ProtectOurCare #ACA10  https://t.co/JIgRflXZxt
We must take time to thank all the health care workers who are on the front line of fighting the spread of #COVID19. https://t.co/rAy2fs8UIG
If you missed my Telephone Town Hall on #COVID19 last night you can listen below.  https://t.co/4tIV0rXLPj
While working from home and abiding by #SocialDistancing to help slow the spread of #COVID19 I filled out the #2020Census online today. You can too! https://t.co/V4SJCPinp8

It is essential that this life-saving PPE is directed to the facilities most in need and this requires a higher level of coordination than now exists. Without this kind of leadership our health care workers will be left unprotected. #COVID19 https://t.co/hLSfBU5kyN
Had a good question during my tele-town hall about the number of #COVID19 cases in Virginia. @VDHgov is tracking that info daily here: https://t.co/qg6nPH6ikC
Getting ready for my tele-town hall on #COVID_19 at 7:00 tonight. You can listen live at https://t.co/3SBGhpAPbo or join the call at 855-927-0895. https://t.co/tsA88qmzlV
I am hosting a telephone town hall on the #COVID19 pandemic at 7pm. Follow along at https://t.co/objry2DtgP

Tomorrow night at 7pm I will be holding a telephone town hall with experts and constituents to discuss the #COVID19 pandemic and what we can all do to stop the spread of the virus. More details about the town hall can be found below.  https://t.co/DCbr5Z2XBw

During this time of crisis young children students educators and institutions need our support. The Supporting Students in Response to #Coronavirus Act provides schools and students the support they need as we confront this public health emergency. #COVID19 https://t.co/FbUqtFjSb4

Had a great discussion earlier today with officials at Sentara CarePlex in Hampton. If anyone has questions they have set up a #COVID19 call center which operates 7 days a week from 9am-7pm ➡️ 1-833-945-2395
Make sure you know how to protect yourself and your family from the spread of #COVID19  https://t.co/Rjvs2ixv67

Our communities need immediate and comprehensive support. I call on my Senate colleagues to recognize the urgency of this moment and put this bill on the president’s desk. #COVID19 #FamiliesFirst https://t.co/nYmKlxCBpV

Our offices will be closed to visitors and my staff will continue working from remote locations. I am honored to represent and to serve the people of VA's 3rd Congressional District. My staff and I are ready to work through this crisis to help in every way possible. #COVID19

As communities across the country respond to the #COVID19 pandemic I am making temporary changes to the operating procedures for my offices in Washington D.C. and Newport News to ensure the safety of my staff and the public. https://t.co/OGLtbqr2kc

The Families First Coronavirus Response Act provides people w/ the health coverage food assistance & financial support they need to cope with the widespread consequences of #COVID19. This bill reflects our responsibility to stand w/ the American people as we confront this crisis https://t.co/jS5m1sE6OE
Allergy/pollen season is upon us. Be sure to know the difference between allergic reactions and potential symptoms of #COVID19  https://t.co/CjdJPBjVS4

More than 32 million U.S. workers do not have the right to earn paid sick leave. Without the economic security of paid sick leave workers are forced to choose between their paycheck and their health. #COVID19 https://t.co/zZrTwyVIgk
CDC should prioritize conserving equipment and systematically addressing any shortages as they occur instead of placing every health care worker at increased risk. #COVID19 https://t.co/d5Muu0hdFq

Shortages of equipment must not result in health care workers being placed at increased risk or being misled into believing that surgical masks will effectively protect them when caring for potentially infected individuals. #coronavirus https://t.co/sWS7tvTkhH

Americans need a fully-funded coordinated government-wide response to stay safe against the #coronavirus. @HouseDemocrats’ $8.3 billion emergency response package will deliver the resources needed to address this public health emergency & protect the American people. #COVID19 https://t.co/6Fq4Uve8Wc
The Trump Administration must take immediate action to protect workers against the coronavirus. https://t.co/hWXzFlqwPe

The American people are relying on the federal government for a full response to the spread of the coronavirus. This $8.3 billion package funds a robust response to the coronavirus including vaccine development and support for state and local governments. https://t.co/ZBwF4V48HW

Want to help prevent the spread of #COVID19? Here’s what the @CDCgov suggests: -Avoid close contact w/people who are sick -Avoid touching your eyes nose & mouth -Stay home when you are sick -Cover your cough or sneeze w/ a tissue then throw tissue in the trash
